intro: Eschscholzia pulchella, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. Eschscholzia pulchella is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
